import React, { useState } from 'react'; import './AllocationModal.css'; const AllocationModal = ({ task, person, onClose }) => { const [hours, setHours] = useState(task.hours.replace('h', '')); const [status, setStatus] = useState(task.status); const [notes, setNotes] = useState(task.notes); const [project, setProject] = useState(task.project || ''); const [taskTitle, setTaskTitle] = useState(task.title || ''); const isNewTask = !task.id || task.id === Date.now(); const handleUpdate = () => { // Here you would typically update the task data console.log('Updating task:', { ...task, hours: `${hours}h`, status, notes }); onClose(); }; const handleCancel = () => { onClose(); }; return (
e.stopPropagation()}>
